alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yellowstone County through 345 PM MDT... At 313 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Custer, or 29 miles north of Hardin, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Yellowstone County. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
